author: Joseph De Avila
description: Connecticut, with the highest per capita income in the country, is staring down a projected $5.1 billion two-year budget hole and looking for options other than raising taxes on its wealthy residents.
title: Connecticut, Nation’s Wealthiest State, May be Tapped Out on Taxing the Rich

author: Bob Price
description: An illegal alien anti-Trump immigration activist has been charged with 103 counts of vandalism at the University of Connecticut.
title: Activist Illegal Alien Charged with 103 Acts of Vandalism, Many Anti-Trump

author: CNBC
description: Four potential candidates to lead the FBI — including former Connecticut Sen. Joe Lieberman — have met with President Donald Trump and Attorney General Jeff Sessions.
title: Trump interviews 4 candidates to post of FBI director

author: Christopher Bucktin
description: As Trump complained in speech at Coast Guard Academy in Connecticut John McCain likened crisis around him to the one that brought down the former US leader Richard Nixon
title: 'No politician gets treated as badly as I do' moans Donald Trump

author: Kevin Liptak, Jeff Zeleny, Sara Murray and Jim Acosta, CNN
description: No one inside the West Wing had to ask how the President's mood was on Wednesday afternoon as aides awaited his return from delivering the commencement address to the Coast Guard Academy in Connecticut.
title: Inside an embattled Trump's most consequential evening of turmoil yet

description: While addressing graduates of the US Coast Guard Academy in New London, Connecticut, President Trump said no politician in history has been treated worse by the media than he has.
title: Trump: No politician has been treated worse - CNN Video

author: Alexandra Wilts
description: Donald Trump has said that “no politician in history...has been treated worse or more unfairly” than him.  “Look at the way I’ve been treated lately, especially by the media,” the US President told cadets graduating from the US Coast Guard Academy in New London, Connecticut.
title: Donald Trump says 'no politician in history has been treated worse' than him

author: Justin Sink
description: Just a day before Donald Trump sets out on his first foreign trip since taking office, the U.S. president said he’s “very close” to picking his new FBI chief, adding that former Connecticut Senator Joseph Lieberman is one of his top choices to replace fired Director James Comey.
title: On Trump Shortlist for FBI Chief: Lieberman, Townsend, Lee

author: DARLENE SUPERVILLE
description: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Donald Trump on Wednesday interviewed four potential candidates to lead the FBI, including former Connecticut Sen. Joe Lieberman, former Oklahoma Gov. Frank Keating and Andrew McCabe, currently the bureau's acting director. Trump also met with Richard McFeely, a former top FBI official. Attorney General Jeff Sessions participated in the interviews. The meetings came more than a week after Trump fired James Comey from his post as FBI director.
title: Trump interviews 4 candidates to post of FBI director

author: DARLENE SUPERVILLE
description: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Donald Trump said Thursday that he is "very close" to naming a new FBI director to replace the one he fired more than a week ago. Asked how close he is to making an announcement, Trump said, "soon." During an Oval Office appearance with Colombian President Juan Manuel Santos, Trump was also asked whether former Connecticut Sen. Joe Lieberman was a candidate for the job. Trump responded, "He is." Trump and Lieberman, who ran for vice president in 2000, discussed the position at the White House on Wednesday. Lieberman gave reporters a thumbs-up as he left the White House and said he and the president had a "good meeting."
title: Trump says he's 'very close' to naming a new FBI director
